logic

Class ClientRequestHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • logic.ClientRequestHandler

  • public class ClientRequestHandler
extends java.lang.Object
    Handles client requests for the server application, routing each request to the appropriate handler method based on the type of request. This class is responsible for processing a wide range of requests, from user login and order management to report generation and park management tasks. Each request handling method receives a ClientRequestDataContainer containing the request data and a ConnectionToClient object for communication back to the client. It returns a ServerResponseBackToClient object encapsulating the response to be sent.
    Author:
    Tamer Amer, Gal Bitton, Rabea Lahham, Bahaldeen Swied, Ron Sisso, Nadav Reubens.

    • Field Detail

      • serverController

        private ServerScreenController serverController

    • Constructor Detail

      • ClientRequestHandler

        public ClientRequestHandler(ServerScreenController serverController)
        Constructs a new ClientRequestHandler with a reference to the server's main controller. This controller is used for logging and managing the server's state and active connections.
        Parameters:
        serverController - the main controller of the server application, responsible for UI updates and connection management

    • Method Detail

      • handleRequest

        public ServerResponseBackToClient handleRequest(ClientRequestDataContainer data,
                                                ConnectionToClient client)
        Processes the incoming request from a client, directing it to the appropriate handler based on the request type. This method acts as a router, delegating tasks such as login, order processing, and report generation to specific handlers, and constructs a response to be sent back to the client.
        Parameters:
        data - the data container holding the request and its associated data
        client - the client connection through which the request was received
        Returns:
        a ServerResponseBackToClient object representing the outcome of the request processing, which can include success, failure, or data payloads

      • handleDeleteOldOrder

        private ServerResponseBackToClient handleDeleteOldOrder(ClientRequestDataContainer data,
                                                        ConnectionToClient client)
        Handles the deletion of an existing order from the database. This method attempts to delete the specified order by invoking a deletion query. Based on the outcome of this operation, it constructs and returns a response object indicating either success or failure of the deletion process.
        Parameters:
        data - The ClientRequestDataContainer containing the order to be deleted. The contained data must be an instance of Order.
        client - The ConnectionToClient representing the connection to the client requesting the deletion. This parameter is currently not used in the method but allows for future extensions, such as sending acknowledgments or error messages directly to the client.
        Returns:
        A ServerResponseBackToClient object indicating the result of the operation. Returns ServerResponse.Order_Deleted_Successfully if the order was successfully deleted, or ServerResponse.Order_Deleted_Failed if the deletion failed.

      • handlePrepareNewOccasionalOrder

        private ServerResponseBackToClient handlePrepareNewOccasionalOrder(ClientRequestDataContainer data,
                                                                   ConnectionToClient client)
        Prepares a new occasional order based on the requested park and visit details provided in the request data. It calculates the exit time based on the park's current estimated stay time and sets the order price according to the park's pricing. If the park specified in the order can be found and all calculations are successfully performed, it marks the order as ready.
        Parameters:
        data - The ClientRequestDataContainer containing the Order to be prepared.
        client - The ConnectionToClient object representing the client making the request. Not used in the method but available for future needs.
        Returns:
        A ServerResponseBackToClient object with the result of the operation, either indicating the order is ready or that the query failed.

      • handleAddOccasionalVisitAsInPark

        private ServerResponseBackToClient handleAddOccasionalVisitAsInPark(ClientRequestDataContainer data,
                                                                    ConnectionToClient client)
        Processes the addition of an occasional visit as an in-park visit. It attempts to insert the provided order into the database as an occasional visit. This method is typically called after an occasional visitor arrives at the park and their order needs to be recorded as such.
        Parameters:
        data - The ClientRequestDataContainer containing the Order to be added as an in-park visit.
        client - The ConnectionToClient object for the client making the request. This parameter is currently not used directly.
        Returns:
        A ServerResponseBackToClient indicating success or failure of adding the visit to the database.

      • handleShowPaymentAtEntrance

        private ServerResponseBackToClient handleShowPaymentAtEntrance(ClientRequestDataContainer data,
                                                               ConnectionToClient client)
        Handles the request to show payment details at the park entrance for a specific order. This method fetches the order by its ID and prepares the details for display or further processing at the park entrance.
        Parameters:
        data - The ClientRequestDataContainer containing the ID of the order for which payment details are requested.
        client - The ConnectionToClient object for the client making the request. Not used directly in this method.
        Returns:
        A ServerResponseBackToClient object containing the order details if found, or an indication of failure if the order cannot be retrieved.

      • handleUpdateOrderStatusCompleted

        private ServerResponseBackToClient handleUpdateOrderStatusCompleted(ClientRequestDataContainer data,
                                                                    ConnectionToClient client)
        Updates the status of an order to 'Completed'. This method determines the type of order (regular or occasional) based on input details and updates its status accordingly. A successful update returns a confirmation response, while a failure in the update process returns an error response.
        Parameters:
        data - The ClientRequestDataContainer containing the order ID and the table (order type) it belongs to.
        client - The ConnectionToClient object for communication with the client. This is not directly used within the method.
        Returns:
        A ServerResponseBackToClient object indicating the result of the update operation.

      • handleUpdateOrderStatusTimePassed

        private ServerResponseBackToClient handleUpdateOrderStatusTimePassed(ClientRequestDataContainer data,
                                                                     ConnectionToClient client)
        Updates the status of an order to 'Time Passed', indicating that the time slot for the order has expired. This operation is typically invoked when an order's scheduled time has passed without confirmation or completion.
        Parameters:
        data - The ClientRequestDataContainer containing the order ID to be updated.
        client - The ConnectionToClient object for the client request. Not directly used within the method.
        Returns:
        A ServerResponseBackToClient object reflecting the success or failure of the status update.

      • handleUpdateOrderStatusInPark

        private ServerResponseBackToClient handleUpdateOrderStatusInPark(ClientRequestDataContainer data,
                                                                 ConnectionToClient client)
        Updates the status of an order to 'In Park', signifying that the visitors associated with the order are currently in the park. This status update is part of managing park capacity and tracking visitor presence.
        Parameters:
        data - The ClientRequestDataContainer containing the order ID to be updated.
        client - The ConnectionToClient connection through which the request was received. Not directly utilized in this method.
        Returns:
        A ServerResponseBackToClient object indicating the outcome of the update.

      • handleImportAllOrdersForNow

        private ServerResponseBackToClient handleImportAllOrdersForNow(ClientRequestDataContainer data,
                                                               ConnectionToClient client)
        Imports all orders for the current day for a specified park. This method is typically used for operational planning and real-time park management, allowing staff to view and manage the day's orders.
        Parameters:
        data - The ClientRequestDataContainer containing the park ID for which orders are requested.
        client - The ConnectionToClient object for the client making the request. Not used within the method.
        Returns:
        A ServerResponseBackToClient object containing a list of all orders for the day or an appropriate error message.

      • handleUpdateOrderStatusConfirmed

        private ServerResponseBackToClient handleUpdateOrderStatusConfirmed(ClientRequestDataContainer data,
                                                                    ConnectionToClient client)
        Updates the status of an order to 'Confirmed', indicating that the order has been officially accepted and confirmed by the visitor or system. This is a crucial step in the booking process, securing the visitor's spot for the scheduled time.
        Parameters:
        data - The ClientRequestDataContainer containing the order to be confirmed.
        client - The ConnectionToClient object representing the client making the request. Not used within this method.
        Returns:
        A ServerResponseBackToClient object reflecting the success or failure of confirming the order.

      • handleUpdateOrderStatusCanceled

        private ServerResponseBackToClient handleUpdateOrderStatusCanceled(ClientRequestDataContainer data,
                                                                   ConnectionToClient client)
        Updates the status of an order to 'Canceled'. After successfully updating the order status, it attempts to notify the next orders in the waiting list for the same time slot and park.
        Parameters:
        data - The data container with the order to be canceled.
        client - The client connection making the request.
        Returns:
        A server response indicating whether the order was successfully canceled or if the operation failed.

      • notifyOrdersFromWaitingList

        public void notifyOrdersFromWaitingList(java.time.LocalDateTime time,
                                        int parkId)
        Notifies the next orders in the waiting list about available spots based on the order's date and park ID. This method is called after canceling an order to fill the available slot with orders from the waiting list.
        Parameters:
        time - The date and time of the canceled order.
        parkId - The ID of the park where the order was scheduled.

      • handleSearchForNotifiedOrders

        private ServerResponseBackToClient handleSearchForNotifiedOrders(ClientRequestDataContainer data,
                                                                 ConnectionToClient client)
        Searches for orders of a specific client that have been notified about available spots from the waiting list. This helps clients to keep track of any changes or updates to their waiting list status.
        Parameters:
        data - The container with the client's ID whose notified orders are being searched.
        client - The client connection making the request.
        Returns:
        A server response containing the list of notified orders or a message indicating no notifications found.

      • handleInsertNewOrderAsWaitNotify

        private ServerResponseBackToClient handleInsertNewOrderAsWaitNotify(ClientRequestDataContainer data,
                                                                    ConnectionToClient client)
        Inserts a new order into the database with a status indicating it's waiting for notification. This status is used for orders that couldn't be immediately confirmed due to lack of availability but are placed on a waiting list for potential openings.
        Parameters:
        data - The data container with the order to be inserted.
        client - The client connection making the request.
        Returns:
        A server response indicating whether the order was added successfully or if the operation failed.

      • handleSearchForSpecificPark

        private ServerResponseBackToClient handleSearchForSpecificPark(ClientRequestDataContainer data,
                                                               ConnectionToClient client)
        Retrieves details for a specific park based on the park ID provided in the request. This information might include park capacity, opening hours, and other relevant park details.
        Parameters:
        data - The data container with the park ID to search for.
        client - The client connection making the request.
        Returns:
        A server response containing the park details or an indication that the park was not found.

      • handleMakeNewParkEstimatedVisitTimeRequest

        private ServerResponseBackToClient handleMakeNewParkEstimatedVisitTimeRequest(ClientRequestDataContainer data,
                                                                              ConnectionToClient client)
        Handles the request to change the estimated visit time for a park. This can be initiated by park managers to adjust visit durations based on various factors like park capacity or special events.
        Parameters:
        data - The data container with the request details.
        client - The client connection making the request.
        Returns:
        A server response indicating the success of sending the request to the department or if there's a pending request of the same type.

      • handleImportAllPendingRequests

        private ServerResponseBackToClient handleImportAllPendingRequests(ClientRequestDataContainer data,
                                                                  ConnectionToClient client)
        Imports all pending requests for park managers' review. This typically includes requests for changing park parameters like capacity or visit time, waiting for approval or denial.
        Parameters:
        data - The data container potentially including a filter or specific request to import.
        client - The client connection making the request.
        Returns:
        A server response containing all pending requests or an error message if the operation fails.

      • handleUpdateRequestInDatabase

        private ServerResponseBackToClient handleUpdateRequestInDatabase(ClientRequestDataContainer data,
                                                                 ConnectionToClient client)
        Updates the status of requests in the database, such as approving or denying pending park manager requests. Each request's new status is determined by the park manager's review.
        Parameters:
        data - The data container with the list of requests and their updated statuses.
        client - The client connection making the request.
        Returns:
        A server response indicating the success or failure of updating the requests.

      • handleMakeNewParkReservedEntriesRequest

        private ServerResponseBackToClient handleMakeNewParkReservedEntriesRequest(ClientRequestDataContainer data,
                                                                           ConnectionToClient client)
        Processes a request to modify the reserved entries for a park. It attempts to insert a new request into the system for departmental review and approval.
        Parameters:
        data - The data container holding the request details.
        client - The client connection through which the request was made. Not used directly in the method.
        Returns:
        A response object indicating whether the request was successfully sent for departmental review or if a similar request is still pending.

      • handleMakeNewParkCapacityRequest

        private ServerResponseBackToClient handleMakeNewParkCapacityRequest(ClientRequestDataContainer data,
                                                                    ConnectionToClient client)
        Handles a request to change the park capacity. Similar to reserved entries requests, it inserts the request into the system for administrative review.
        Parameters:
        data - The data container with the park capacity change request.
        client - The connection to the client making the request. This parameter is not utilized within the method.
        Returns:
        A response indicating the outcome of the request submission, either successful submission or a notification of a pending request of the same type.

      • handleCreateTotalAmountDivisionReport

        private ServerResponseBackToClient handleCreateTotalAmountDivisionReport(ClientRequestDataContainer data,
                                                                         ConnectionToClient client)
        Initiates the creation of a Total Amount Division Report for a park. This report details the division of visitors by category within a specified time frame.
        Parameters:
        data - The data container with the information needed to generate the report.
        client - The client requesting the report generation. Not directly used in the method.
        Returns:
        A server response indicating whether the report was successfully generated or if the report generation failed.

      • handleImportTotalAmountDivisionReport

        private ServerResponseBackToClient handleImportTotalAmountDivisionReport(ClientRequestDataContainer data,
                                                                         ConnectionToClient client)
        Retrieves a previously generated Total Amount Division Report, returning it as a byte array suitable for client-side rendering or processing.
        Parameters:
        data - The data container identifying the specific report to be retrieved.
        client - The client connection requesting the report. Not used directly in the method.
        Returns:
        A response containing the report as a byte array if found, or an indication that the report could not be found.

      • handleImportVisitsReport

        private ServerResponseBackToClient handleImportVisitsReport(ClientRequestDataContainer data,
                                                            ConnectionToClient client)
        Fetches a Visits Report as a byte array, allowing for client-side presentation or further analysis. The report provides details on park visits over a specified period.
        Parameters:
        data - The request data specifying the report to be fetched.
        client - The client connection making the request. Not used within the method.
        Returns:
        A server response containing the requested report as a byte array, or an error if the report is not found.

      • handleCreateVisitsReport

        private ServerResponseBackToClient handleCreateVisitsReport(ClientRequestDataContainer data,
                                                            ConnectionToClient client)
        Creates a Visits Report detailing park visitations within a specified timeframe, including data on visitor numbers and visit durations.
        Parameters:
        data - The data container with the parameters for report generation.
        client - The client connection requesting the report. Not directly utilized in the method.
        Returns:
        A response indicating the success or failure of the report generation process.

      • handleCreateCancellationsReport

        private ServerResponseBackToClient handleCreateCancellationsReport(ClientRequestDataContainer data,
                                                                   ConnectionToClient client)
        Initiates the generation of a cancellations report based on the specified criteria in the report object. This report includes details on all cancellations within a given time frame.
        Parameters:
        data - The container holding the cancellations report request data.
        client - The client connection requesting the report generation. Not used directly.
        Returns:
        A response indicating the success or failure of generating the cancellations report.

      • handleImportCancellationsReport

        private ServerResponseBackToClient handleImportCancellationsReport(ClientRequestDataContainer data,
                                                                   ConnectionToClient client)
        Retrieves a previously generated cancellations report as a byte array, allowing for download or display.
        Parameters:
        data - The container with the cancellations report to be retrieved.
        client - The client connection requesting the report. Not used directly.
        Returns:
        A response containing the cancellations report as a byte array or an error if the report cannot be found.

      • handleCreateUsageReport

        private ServerResponseBackToClient handleCreateUsageReport(ClientRequestDataContainer data,
                                                           ConnectionToClient client)
        Generates a usage report detailing park usage statistics over a specified period. This report helps in understanding the park's operational efficiency and visitor distribution.
        Parameters:
        data - The data container with information necessary for creating the usage report.
        client - The client connection making the request. Not used directly.
        Returns:
        A response indicating the outcome of the report generation, either successful or failed.

      • handleImportUsageReport

        private ServerResponseBackToClient handleImportUsageReport(ClientRequestDataContainer data,
                                                           ConnectionToClient client)
        Fetches a previously generated usage report, providing the data as a byte array for client-side processing or display.
        Parameters:
        data - The container specifying which usage report to retrieve.
        client - The client connection requesting the report. Not utilized directly.
        Returns:
        A server response containing the usage report as a byte array, or an error if the report is not found.

      • handleSearchForGuidesWithStatusPending

        private ServerResponseBackToClient handleSearchForGuidesWithStatusPending(ClientRequestDataContainer data,
                                                                          ConnectionToClient client)
        Searches for guides with a pending approval status. This method is typically used by park managers or administrators to review guides awaiting approval.
        Parameters:
        data - The data container potentially specifying criteria for the search.
        client - The client connection making the request. Not directly used.
        Returns:
        A response with a list of guides who have pending status, or an error if the search fails.

      • handleUpdateGuideAsApproved

        private ServerResponseBackToClient handleUpdateGuideAsApproved(ClientRequestDataContainer data,
                                                               ConnectionToClient client)
        Approves one or more guides, updating their status in the system. This operation is usually performed by park managers or administrators to grant new guides access to the system.
        Parameters:
        data - The container with a list of guides to be approved.
        client - The client connection requesting the update. Not used directly.
        Returns:
        A response indicating the success or failure of the guide approval process.

      • handleSearchForAvailableDates

        private ServerResponseBackToClient handleSearchForAvailableDates(ClientRequestDataContainer data,
                                                                 ConnectionToClient client)
        Searches for available dates for new orders within a 7-day window from a specified starting point. This method is helpful for visitors or agents looking to find open slots for park visits.
        Parameters:
        data - The data container with the initial date from which to search for availability.
        client - The client connection making the request. Not utilized within the method.
        Returns:
        A response with a list of available dates or a null response if there are no available dates.

      • handleAddNewOrderIfAvailable

        private ServerResponseBackToClient handleAddNewOrderIfAvailable(ClientRequestDataContainer data,
                                                                ConnectionToClient client)
        Attempts to add a new order if the requested date and time are available. This method checks the park's capacity and existing bookings before confirming the new order.
        Parameters:
        data - The data container with the new order details.
        client - The client connection attempting to place a new order. Not used directly.
        Returns:
        A response indicating whether the new order could be added or if it was not possible due to lack of availability.

      • handleLoginAsEmployee

        private ServerResponseBackToClient handleLoginAsEmployee(ClientRequestDataContainer data,
                                                         ConnectionToClient client)
        Handles the login request for an employee. It verifies the employee's credentials and approval status in the system. If the employee is already connected, it updates the response to indicate this status.
        Parameters:
        data - The container with the employee login information.
        client - The connection to the client making the request.
        Returns:
        A response indicating the outcome of the login attempt, including success, failure due to SQL exception, or already connected status.

      • handleLoginAsGuide

        private ServerResponseBackToClient handleLoginAsGuide(ClientRequestDataContainer data,
                                                      ConnectionToClient client)
        Processes the login request for a guide. It checks if the guide is approved in the system and not already connected. Responses vary based on the verification outcome and any SQL exceptions encountered.
        Parameters:
        data - The data container with the guide's login information.
        client - The client connection requesting the login.
        Returns:
        A server response indicating the result of the login attempt, which could be successful, failed due to SQL issues, or already connected status.

      • handleLoginAsVisitor

        private ServerResponseBackToClient handleLoginAsVisitor(ClientRequestDataContainer data,
                                                        ConnectionToClient client)
        Manages the login process for a visitor. This includes verifying the visitor's access rights and handling any SQL exceptions.
        Parameters:
        data - The data container with the visitor's information.
        client - The connection to the client attempting to login.
        Returns:
        A response detailing the outcome of the login attempt, such as failure due to SQL exceptions or success.

      • handleSearchForRelevantOrder

        private ServerResponseBackToClient handleSearchForRelevantOrder(ClientRequestDataContainer data,
                                                                ConnectionToClient client)
        Searches for an order based on its ID. This method is utilized for retrieving specific order details, handling cases where the search may fail due to SQL exceptions.
        Parameters:
        data - The container with the order ID to search for.
        client - The client connection making the request.
        Returns:
        A response with the order details if found or an error message indicating the search failure.
